Name: A.T.Still University_APD_Oct'25
Immediate_Gaps__c: ["Confirm numeric budget in Budget_allocated__c and Total_spends__c.","Provide specific names and roles in Authority__c for all decision-makers.","Include a project timeline in Project_timeline__c or Implementation_Timeline__c.","Detail technology stack, including ERP and contract management solutions."]
Tier_1_Summary__c: Need and authority are strong, and next steps are action-oriented, but budget lacks numeric confirmation while timeline details are moderately clear.
Tier_2_Summary__c: Account revenue and deal size are well-documented, sector defined clearly, but tech stack information is sparse and incomplete.
About_the_Company_Line_of_Business__c: A.T. Still University (ATSU), founded in 1892 in Kirksville, Missouri, is the world’s first osteopathic medical school and a leading private, non-profit health sciences university emphasizing whole-person care and service in underserved communities. It operates campuses in Missouri, Arizona, and California, offering graduate programs in medicine, dentistry, and health sciences. ATSU is currently expanding its footprint by relocating its College for Healthy Communities from Santa Maria to a new 65,000 sq ft facility in San Luis Obispo, opening in 2026, to enhance training and regional healthcare impact. Additionally, in 2025, ATSU formed a strategic partnership with George Fox University in Oregon to strengthen rural healthcare education and create new clinical and student pathways.
Key_Information_1__c: Director of Purchasing at A.T. Still University. Using ERP and E-Procurement solution.
Secondary_Research_on_Account__c:
ATSU positions itself as a multidisciplinary health sciences university rather than just a medical school; this allows offerings beyond DO degree – e.g., dentistry, allied health.

Its emphasis on underserved populations and community health can be leveraged in programmatic partnerships and outreach.

The osteopathic medicine heritage, along with manual therapy and whole-person care, may offer a differentiated brand compared to conventional medical schools.

Its research support infrastructure signals growing emphasis on scholarship and translational work (useful for partnerships, grants, collaborations).

The multiple campuses model (Midwest + Southwest + California) offers geographic reach and possibly diversity of student and clinical sites.

High requisitioner turnover

Manual sourcing processes

Is_the_challenge_solvable_by_Zycus__c:
Merlin AI suite offering intelligent intake, negotiation, and contract analysis

Zero-debt, founder-led, stable company

Native, end-to-end Source-to-Pay platform

Strong analyst recognition (Gartner, Forrester)

Quick integration with Microsoft GP and minimal user training required
Meeting_Summary__c:
Corey Louder is exploring the eProcurement landscape as AT Still nears contract renegotiation with their current vendor.

The university has used an eProcurement system since 2014; Corey initiated the automation journey to reduce manual efforts.

AT Still now operates across multiple campuses while maintaining staff size—automation has been key.

Their current system lacks AI capabilities and collaborative intake processes, sparking interest in new solutions.

Zycus was introduced as a potential alternative, offering a complete Source-to-Pay (S2P) suite with modular flexibility.

Michael emphasized Zycus’ innovation history, organic platform, and strong customer-centric values.

Zycus’ Merlin AI suite (since 2018) was highlighted as a differentiator with autonomous agents and smart intake.

Corey acknowledged pain points with training requisitioners and turnover, making intuitive, low-barrier tools valuable.

Zycus presented AI functionalities like smart contract review, autonomous negotiation, and policy-driven guided buying.

Corey’s current ERP is Microsoft Dynamics GP; Zycus confirmed seamless integration capability.

Sourcing events are limited and mostly done via GPOs, making full-scale eSourcing less relevant.

Contract management is handled separately by legal; Zycus requested an introduction to explore value there.

Corey agreed to share Zycus’ info with legal (Michelle Gibson) and potentially set up a joint demo.

Suggested next steps include a tailored P2P demo involving finance team members and a short discovery session.

Corey is open to exploring further if Zycus demonstrates distinct efficiency or value.

Zycus emphasized flexibility in rollout and strength in AI, integration, and user adoption.

Michael positioned Zycus as a debt-free, founder-led company focused on long-term value.
